headline: Fubo shares dip on reported DOJ probe into Disney deal
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Fubotv Inc (NYSE:FUBO) fell 3.8% after Bloomberg reported that the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) is investigating Walt Disney Company’s (NYSE:DIS) acquisition of a controlling stake in the streaming company. The probe is centered on concerns that the deal could lead to undue market concentration in the sports streaming sector.

The probe is centered on concerns that the deal could lead to undue market concentration in the sports streaming sector.

headline: Vertiv earnings beat, DOJ & Disney–fuboTV deal, Novavax COVID shot
summary: Brad Smith outlines the top stories on Wall Street as part of Yahoo Finance's Market Minute. Vertiv Holdings (VRT) stock is soaring after the company reported first quarter earnings that beat Wall Street estimates and increased its full-year guidance, signaling strong artificial intelligence (AI) demand. The US Department of Justice is looking into Disney's (DIS) deal with fuboTV (FUBO) for possible antitrust concerns. Novavax (NVAX) stock surges after the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requested COVID vaccine data from the company, which could signal that FDA approval is incoming. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
